sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Motango ya bato oyo bazobela maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19) ezokoma mingi noki na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, banda mokolo ya 1 sanza ya yambo kino mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020
translated: [' Kobakisama ya noki ya maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19) na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, mokolo ya 1 sanza ya liboso kino mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020 ']

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Soki totali bato nyonso oyo bazobela maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19) bazomonisa bilembo ya ndenge moko na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, yango ezondimisa ete, ata eza na banivo ekeseni na kotalela mokili mokomoko, maladi ya COVID-19 ezopanzana noki na mikili nyonso.
translated: [' Bozongisi ya bato oyo bazobela maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19) ezali komonisa makambo ya ndenge moko na mikili ya Union Européenne/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni bandimi ete, ata na eleko mosusu na kotalela mboka, maladi mabe ya COVID-19 ezali kokende liboso noki na mikili nyonso. ']

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Na kotalela makambo oyo esalemi na Italie, mikili, balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs basengeli mpenza kobongama mpo na koyamba bato mingi ya maladi ya COVID-19 oyo ekosenga ete basalisa bango, mingimingi na soins intensifs.
translated: [' Na kotalela makambo euti na Italie, mikili, balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs basengeli kobakisa komibongisa na bango mpo na ebele ya bato ya maladi oyo baza na COVID-19 oyo ekosenga lisalisi ya monganga, mpe mingimingi soins intensifs. ']

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019, bakangaki bato mingi na maladi ya mpema oyo eyebani te na mboka Wuhan, na etuka ya Hubei, na Chine.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019, bato mingi babelaki maladi ya mpema oyo eyebani te na Wuhan, na etuka ya Hubei, na Chine. ']

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Na mokolo ya 9 sanza ya yambo 2020, Centre ya Chine oyo ebundisaka mpe ebatelaka maladi elobaki ete maladi yango eutaki na lolenge ya sika ya coronavirisi oyo babengi sikoyo maladi ya makasi ya mpema coronavirisi 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 9 sanza ya liboso 2020, Esika ya kolandela mpe kopekisa maladi na Chine elobaki ete kisi ya causative ezalaki coronavirisi ya sika oyo babengaka yango sikoyo maladi makasi ya mpema coronavirisi 2 (SARS-CoV-2). ']

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Banda wana, bazobenga maladi oyo eutaka na SARS-CoV-2 ete maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19).
translated: [' Sima, maladi oyo eutaka na infection ya SRAS-CoV-2 ebengami maladi ya coronavirisi (COVID-19). ']

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Bilembeteli tozali na yango lelo emonisi ete bato 80% oyo baza na COVID-19 baza na maladi ya mwa moke, ndakisa maladi ya mpema elongo to kozanga mpasi ya kopema, mpe mingi na bango bazobika.
translated: [' Bilembeli ya mokolo ya lelo ezali ete bato 80% oyo baza na COVID-19 baza na maladi ya pete, elingi koloba maladi ya mpema oyo eza na pneumonia to te, mpe mingi na bango bazobika. ']

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Na bato 14%, COVID-19 ezouta na maladi makasi oyo ezosenga bakota lopitalo, ebongo bato 6% bazobela maladi makasi mpenza mpe ezosenga bazala na soins intensifs.
translated: [' Na caca bato ya kobela 14%, COVID-19 ezokoma maladi ya makasi koleka oyo esengaka bakota lopitalo kasi 6% oyo batikali bazali kobela makasi oyo ezosenga bazala na soins intensifs. ']

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Motango ya bato bakoti lopitalo mpo na COVID-19 oyo bazokufa eza 4%.
translated: [' Liwa ya bato ya maladi bakotaki lopitalo mpo na COVID-19 eza ca 4%. ']

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Na bolukiluki oyo, tozotala ndenge makambo ezosalema na makambo nyonso ya COVID-19 na mokili mokomoko ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni (UK) mpe tozokokokanisa yango na oyo ya etuka ya Hubei, na Chine.
translated: [' Na bolukiluki oyo, tozotala ndenge makambo ezosalema na ndenge bato mingi bazobela COVID-19 na mokili mokomoko ya Eropa/Esika nyonso ya Nkita ya Eropa (UE/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa (UE/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa) mpe na Royaume-Uni (UK) mpe kokokanisa yango na oyo ya etuka ya Hubei, na Chine. ']

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Tozokokanisa mpe motango ya sikoyo ya bato bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa pe na Royaume-Uni na oyo ya Italie banda na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020.
translated: [' Tozokokanisa mpe motango ya sikoyo ya bato bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni na oyo ya Italie na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo –15 sanza ya misato 2020. ']

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Bato bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni
translated: [' Bato bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni ']

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Ndenge esalemaki na Chine, COVID-19 epanzanaki na bamboka mosusu mpe maladi wana ya COVID-19 ezopanzana ndenge moko na mikili mosusu kaka ndenge esalemaki mboka wana.
translated: [' Na nsima na Chine, COVID-19 epanzanaki lisusu na bisika mpe dynamic ya maladi mabe ya COVID-19 na mokili mobimba ezolanda sikoyo oyo ya mboka oyo. ']

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya misato 2020, diretere ya organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS) alobaki ete COVID-19 eza maladi mabe.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya misato 2020, diretere ya organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS) alobaki ete COVID-19 eza maladi mabe. ']

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya misato likambo ya Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri mpe baninga na ye, elobelaki bato ya Eropa ya liboso oyo babeli COVID-19 na kotalela ndimbola oyo OMS ezopesa.
translated: [' Na nimero ya 5 sanza ya misato ya Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri mpe baninga na ye balobelaki bato ya liboso ya Eropa oyo bazalaki na COVID-19 na kotalela ndimbola ya likambo ya OMS. ']

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa, bato misato ya liboso oyo bazwaki maladi elobamaki na France na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya yambo 2020; eza bato oyo bautaki na Wuhan, na etuka ya Hubei, na Chine mpe bazongaki na France.
translated: [' Na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa, bato misato ya liboso oyo bazalaki na maladi bazwaki yango na France na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya liboso 2020 na bato oyo bautaki Wuhan, na etuka ya Hubei, na Chine. ']

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020, bato bazalaki kobela maladi ya COVID-19 na mikili nyonso 30 ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni (UK), mpe banda mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 mpe kotanga dati wana, bato 39 768 babeli yango mpe bato 1 727 bakufaki na maladi wana mpe na Italie mpamba bato 17 750 bazwaki yango kasi bato 1 441 bakufaki.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020, bato ya COVID-19 bamonanaki na mikili nyonso 30 ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni (UK), esika oyo na kati ya mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 mpe dati yango ezalaki, bato ya kobela 39,768 mpe bato 1 727 bakufaki, mpe bato 17 750 bazwaki yango mpe bato 1 441 bakufaki kaka na Italie. ']

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Kozwa motango nyonso mpe bato nyonso oyo bazwi COVID-19
translated: [' Kozwa motango ya cumulative mpe lolenge ya kosalisa bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 ']

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: Na centre ya Eropa oyo ebundisaka mpe ebatelaka maladi (ECDC), motango ya bato ya COVID-19 na mokili mokomoko, oyo bazwaka kaka na ba source officiel na ndakisa ministere ya santé ya mikili nyonso, bakonzi ya santé ya mokili mpe ya etuka mpe na OMS, etyamaka ya sika mokolo nyonso na 8H00 na ntongo.
translated: [' Na centre ya Eropa mpo na kopekisa maladi mpe kobundisa yango (ECDC), motango ya bato ya COVID-19 oyo bayebisaki na mokili mokomoko na mokili mobimba, oyo bazwaka kaka na bisika ya Leta na ndakisa ministere ya kolongono ya nzoto ya mikili, bakonzi ya kolongono ya nzoto ya mboka mpe ya etuka mpe OMS, batyaka yango ya sika mokolo nyonso na 8H00 ya ntongo. ']

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Basalelaki bansango wana mpo na koyeba ndenge COVID-19 ezopanzana na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, mpe bakokanisaka yango na ya Italie.
translated: [' Basalelaki bansango oyo mpo na koyeba ndenge COVID-19 ezali koleka na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, mpe kokokanisa yango na oyo ya Italie. ']

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Na oyo etali ndenge bato oyo baza mpenza na maladi ya COVID-19, totalelaka mikolo 14 oyo yango ekomaka makasi mpo na bato ya COVID-19, yango wana totalelaka ndenge COVID-19 ekolaka, na mokili mokomoko ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, na eleko ebandi na 1 sanza ya liboso kino 15 sanza ya misato 2020.
translated: [' Na proxy ya bato oyo baza na COVID-19 oyo bazali kosala mosala, tosalaki kalkile ya mikolo 14 oyo bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 ndenge bazokanisa, yango wana totalelaka ndenge maladi ya COVID-19 ezali, na mokili mokomoko ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, na eleko ya 1 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 1 sanza ya misato 2020. ']

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Topesaki mpe motango nyonso ya bato ya maladi na mokili mokomoko na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020 na 8H00 na ntongo, tokokanisaki yango na motango ya Italie banda na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020.
translated: [' Tolakisaki mpe motango ya cumulative ya bato oyo bazobela maladi ya mboka mokomoko na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020 8:00 na ntongo soki tokokanisi yango na oyo ya Italie na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020. ']

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Ndenge bato bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni
translated: [' Makambo ya COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni ']

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Ndenge bato bazokolisa maladi COVID-19 na mikolo 14 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni ezolanda ndenge esalemaki na etuka ya Hubei (Chine) (Motango1).
translated: [' Makambo oyo esalemaki na mikolo 14 ya mikolo 14 oyo bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni mbala mingi elandaki oyo ya etuka ya Hubei (Chine) (Motango 1). ']

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Mpo na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe Royaume-Uni, maladi ya COVID-19 ebandaki kokoma mingi pene ya mokolo ya 21 sanza ya mibale mpe na nsima ekomaki mwa mingi pene ya mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale 2020 (Bansango mosusu).
translated: [' Mpo na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe Royaume-Uni mobimba, maladi ya COVID-19 ebandaki komata pene ya mokolo ya 21 sanza ya mibale mpe na nsima emataki makasi pene ya mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale 2020 (Biloko oyo ebakisamaka). ']

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Esimbamaki mingi na motango ya bato mingi oyo bazalaki kozwa maladi yango na Italie, kasi na mikili nyonso ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa motango ya bato ya maladi COVID-19 ezalaki mpe komata ndenge moko (Bansango mosusu).
translated: [' Yango eutaki mingimingi na bokoli ya noki ya motango ya bato oyo balobaki ete bauti Italie, kasi mikili nyonso mosusu ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe Royaume-Uni emonisaki ndenge bokoli ya ndenge moko na maladi ya COVID-19 (Biloko oyo ebakisamaka). ']

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Motango 2 ezomonisa motango nyonso ya bato bazobela COVID-19, na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni soki tokokanisi yango na oyo ya Italie banda na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020.
translated: [' Motango 2 ezomonisa motango ya bato bazobela COVID-19, na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni soki tokokanisi yango na oyo ya Italie banda na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya yambo kino na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 2020. ']

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Ezomonisa ete, na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato na 8H00 na ntongo, mikili 15 mosusu ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni ezalaki na motango ya bato ya maladi wana ndenge moko na Italie kaka mwa bamposo 3 to moke liboso.
translated: [' Emonisi polele ete, na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato 8:00 na ntongo, mikili 15 mosusu ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe Royaume-Uni basi balobelaki motango ya bato ya maladi oyo ekokani na oyo ya Italie kaka mposo 3 liboso to moke. ']

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Ba résultat na biso ezolakisa ete motango bato oyo bazwi COVID-19 ezomata makasi na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni.
translated: [' Ba résultat na biso emonisi ete motango ya bato oyo bazali na COVID-19 oyo bayebisaki bango ezali kobakisama noki na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni. ']

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Makambo tomoni na bato nyonso bazobela COVID-19 ezolakisa ete maladi mabe ezopanzana ndenge moko na mikili misusu.
translated: [' Makambo oyo emonani na ndenge bato mingi bazobela COVID-19 emonisi ete maladi mabe ezokende liboso na lombango oyo ekokani na mikili nyonso. ']

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Eza bongo ata mikili eza na banivo ekeseni, bato oyo basalaka mosala ya monganga bazosunga bato ndenge moko te, mpe mbala mosusu kolimbola maladi na ndenge mosusu na mikili mpe mibeko ekeseni mpo na kopona bato ya maladi oyo basengeli kosalisa ekzame mpo na koyeba soki baza na COVID-19, ata mpe kosala ekzame na nsima.
translated: [' Ezali bongo atako mikili eza na bileko ekeseni, bokeseni na ndenge ya kobundisa kolongono ya nzoto na ekolo mobimba, mpe mbala mosusu kolimbola bato ya maladi ekeseni na mikili mpe mayele ekeseni mpo na kopona bato ya maladi oyo basengeli kosala ekzame mpo na koyeba soki baza na COVID-19, ata mpe kosala ekzame ya kokanga. ']

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Na ebandeli ya sanza ya misato 2020, minganga ya Italie bisika maladi ezalaki, balobaki ete bato ya maladi 10% oyo baza na COVID-19 baza na mposa ya soins intensifs mpe bapanzi-nsango balobaki ete soins intensifs ya balopitalo ya bituka wana etondaki koleka ndelo.
translated: [' Na ebandeli ya sanza ya misato 2020, minganga ya Italie bisika maladi ezalaki na Italie balimbolaki likambo moko oyo CA 10% ya bato ya maladi oyo bazalaki na COVID-19 basengelaki na soins intensifs mpe bisika ya bapanzi-nsango balobaki ete balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs na bisika wana esi ekomaki na makoki mingi. ']

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Bansango ya bato ya COVID-19 oyo bakotaki lopitalo mpe/to na soins intensifs eza sikoyo na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpo na bato 6% mpamba mpe 1%, (bansango elakisami te).
translated: [' Bansango etali kokota na bato oyo baza na COVID-19 na lopitalo mpe/to na soins intensifs ezali sikoyo na nivo ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpo na bato 6% mpamba mpe 1% ya bato oyo bazobela yango (bansango elakisami te). ']

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Kasi, basengeli kosangisa yango malamumalamu mpo na kobakisa yango na bansango ya sika oyo ezolobeli mingi motango ya bato oyo baza na maladi mpe motango ya baoyo bakufi.
translated: [' Kasi, basengeli kozwa yango na mode ya systeme mpo na kobakisa bansango ya bokengeli ya sikoyo oyo ezolobela mingi motango ya bato oyo balobi ete baza na maladi mpe motango ya bato bakufi. ']

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Bolukiluki moko oyo esalemaki na 2010–11 emonisaki mbongwana monene na soins intensifs mpe ya bambeto ya katikati na Eropa, ezalaki 29,2 na Allemagne mpe bambeto 4,2 mpo na bato 100 000 na Portugal.
translated: [' Bolukiluki moko oyo esalemaki na 2010–11 emonisaki bokeseni monene na kozala ya soins intensifs mpe bambeto ya katikati na Eropa, banda na 29,2 na Allemagne kino na bambeto 4,2 mpo na bato 100 000 na Portugal. ']

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Elimboli ete mikili ekoki kozala na makoki mingi to moke koleka Italie (12,5 soins intensif mpe bambeto ya katikati mpo na bato 100 000 na 2010–11).
translated: [' Elimboli ete mikili ekoki kozala na biloko mingi to moke koleka Italie (12,5 soins intensif mpe bambeto ya katikati mpo na bato 100 000 na 2010–11). ']

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Kobongisa makambo ya kosalisa bato ya maladi elekeli minganga, mpo motango ya pene mpo na mokili nyonso ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe Royaume-Uni na kotalela bato bakoti lopitalo mpo na COVID-19 mpe mpo na a > 90% ya likama ya kozanga bambeto na soins intensif, epesami na makambo ya sika ya motoba ya ECDC mpo na botaleli ya lombango ya likama ya COVID-19.
translated: [' Makambo ya modele etali kotonda ya makoki ya minganga, na makanisi mpo na mokili mokomoko ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni na ndenge bato oyo bakotaki lopitalo mpo na COVID-19 oyo baza na likama ya > 90% ya koleka makoki ya bambeto ya soins intensifs, epesami na update ya motoba ya ECDC ya botaleli ya lombango ya likama ya COVID-19. ']

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Mpo bato ya maladi bakomi mingi na bisika mosusu na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, mpe balopitalo na bisika ya soins intensifs esalelamaka mbala mingi mpo na kobomba bato ya etuka moko boye, bansango etali bamaladi mpe bambeto ya soins intensifs esengeli ezala libre na eteni ebengami Nomenclature ya biteni ya nivo ya bansango 2 (NUTS-2).
translated: [' Banda bato ya maladi baza kino sikoyo na bisika mosusu na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni, mpe mbala mingi balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs esalisaka na bato ya etuka oyo eyebani malamu, bansango etali bato oyo baza na maladi mpe bambeto ya soins intensifs esengeli kosalema malamu na nivo ya Nomenclature ya bisika ya teritware mpo na statistics 2 (NUTS-2). ']

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Makambo esalemi na Italie mpe oyo ezosalema sikoyo na mikili mosusu emonisi ete maladi mabe ya COVID-19 ezopanzana noki na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni.
translated: [' Makambo euti na Italie mpe ndenge makambo ezosalema sikoyo na mikili mosusu emonisi ete maladi mabe ya COVID-19 ezokende liboso noki na mikili ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa mpe na Royaume-Uni. ']

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Mikili, balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs esengeli komibongisa na ndenge ya bakosala makambo soki bato mingi bazwi SARS-CoV-2 mpe soki motango ya bato oyo bazwi COVID-19 oyo bazoluka lisalisi ekomi mingi, mpe mingimingi na soins intensif, na ndakisa oyo ezosalema na bamboka ya Italie esika maladi wana ezali.
translated: [' Mikili, balopitalo mpe bisika ya soins intensifs esengeli bongo komibongisa mpo na koyeba soki SARS-CoV-2 ezopanzana malamu na kati ya bato mpe komata ya motango ya bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 oyo ezosenga kozala na mposa ya lisalisi ya monganga, mpe mingimingi soins intensif, lekola oyo ezosalema na bituka ya Italie esika maladi ezali. ']

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Ndenge bamonisaki yango na botaleli ya lombango ya likama oyo esalemaki kala te na ECDC, metode ya noki, ya malamu mpe ebongi mpenza eza ntina mpo na kokanga SARS-COV-2 nzela epanzana te, kolongola likebi na bato oyo bazozwa maladi mpe kotya yango na kokitsa ntalo ya contamintaion; mpo koluka koyeba liboso ndenge bato mingi bakobela ekosalisa mpenza te bato bazwaka bikateli mpe balopitalo bakozala te na ntango ya kokanga ntina na yango, kondima yango mpe kobongama na kosunga soki bameki yango te liboso.
translated: [' Ndenge emonisami na botaleli ya lombango ya ECDC oyo euti kosalema, mayele ya noki, ya proactive mpe ya mobimba eza ntina mingi mpo na kokanga SARS-COV-2 nzela epanzana te, mpe mbongwana ya kokanga yango nzela mpe ekoma kokitisa yango, mpo ete bokoli ya noki ya motango ya bato ya maladi ekoki kopesa te bato bazozwa bikateli mpe balopitalo ntango ekoki te mpo na kokanga ntina, kondima mpe kobongola eyano na bango na kolanda soki esalemi te liboso ya ntango. ']

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Botaleli ya lombango ya likama ezolobela mpe bibongiseli ya sante ya bato mingi mpo na kolembisa bokoli ya maladi mabe.
translated: [' Botaleli ya noki ya likama elobeli mpe mibeko ya kolongono ya nzoto mpo na kokitisa bopusi ya maladi mabe. ']

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Eza na mwa libaku moke na ntango oyo mikili ezali na libaku ya kobakisa controle ya milende bazosala mpo na kosala ete SARS-CoV-2 epanzana mingi te mpe kokotisa pression na minganga.
translated: [' Eza na lininisa ya mokuse ya libaku oyo mikili eza na likoki ya kobakisa lisusu makasi na kolandela makambo mpo na kokanga SARS-CoV-2 nzela epanzana te mpe kokitisa mpasi ya minganga. ']

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Soki basali yango te, bibongiseli ya sante ya mikili mosusu ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa ekozala na bato mingi lisusu oyo bakobela mpe ekosenga batya bango na soins intensifs na mikolo to na bamposo ezoya.
translated: [' Kozanga kokokisa yango, emonani ete bibongiseli ya kolongono ya nzoto ya mikili mosusu ya Eropa/Esika ya Nkita ya Eropa ekokutana na bato mingi ya maladi oyo esengaka lisalisi ya makasi na mikolo to baposo ezoya. ']

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Kobima ya maladi ya coronavirisi 2019 (COVID-19), oyo euti na maladi makasi ya mpéma (SARS) coronavirirsi 2 (SARS-CoV-2), esi ebomi bato koleka 3 000 mpe ezwi bato koleka 80 000 na Chine mpe na bisika mosusu na mokili mobimba, yango esali ete ekoma likama monene mpo na bato.
translated: [' Kobima ya maladi ya Coronavirisi 2019 (COVID-19), oyo euti na maladi makasi ya mpema (SARS) coronavirisi 2 (SARS-CoV-2), kino sikoyo ebomi bato koleka 3 000 mpe ezwi bato koleka 80 000 na Chine mpe na bisika mosusu na mokili, mpe yango ebimisi likama ya bato. ']

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Na boyokani na ndeko na yango virisi, SARS-CoV, oyo esalaki bankoto ya bato babela SARS na 2003, ekoki kozala ete SARS-CoV-2 eutaki mpe na bangembo mpe eza na bilembo ya ndenge moko mpe ekotaka na ndenge moko.
translated: [' Ndenge moko na virisi na yango ya homologous, SARS-CoV, oyo ebimisaki SARS na bankoto ya bato na 2003, SARS-CoV-2 ekoki mpe kouta na bangembo mpe ebimisaka bilembo ya ndenge moko na nzela ya mechanisme ya ndenge moko. ']

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Atako bongo, COVID-19 eza makasi mingi te mpe ezoboma bato mingi te lokola SARS kasi ezopanzana na bato mingi mpe ezonyokola mingi mibange koleka bilenge mpe ezozwa mingi mibali koleka basi.
translated: [' Kasi, COVID-19 eza na makasi mingi te mpe ezoboma bato mingi te koleka SARS kasi epanzanaka mingi mpe ezozwa mibange mingi koleka bilenge mpe mibali mingi koleka basi. ']

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Ndenge mikanda oyo ezolobela maladi yango ezokoba kokoma mingi, mokano ya lisolo oyo eza ya kopesa bansango eyei na ntango malamu mpe na kolobela misala ya bolukiluki oyo ezosalema na likambo oyo.
translated: [' Mpo na kotalela motango ya mikanda oyo ezali kobakisama noki na maladi oyo ezali kobima, lisolo oyo ezali komeka kopesa botaleli na ntango ebongi mpe na molai ya likambo ya bolukiluki oyo ezali kokola noki. ']

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Tokolobela makambo ya ntina na oyo etali epidemiologie, etiologie, virologie, ndenge ya koyeba yango, ndenge ya kobikisa, pronostique, mpe libateli na maladi yango.
translated: [' Tokolobela makambo ya ntina etali epidemiologie, etiologie, virologie, ndenge ya koyeba yango, ndenge ya kobikisa, pronostique, mpe kopekisa maladi wana. ']

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Ata soki mituna mingi eza nanu te na biyano, tokanisi ete lisolo oyo ekosalisa yo na koyeba mpe kosilisa maladi oyo ya mabe.
translated: [' Atako mituna mingi mizali naino kosenga biyano, tozali kolikya ete botaleli oyo ezali kosalisa na kososola mpe kosilisa bokɔnɔ oyo ezali kokanela. ']

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: Fete ya printemps ya mokolo ya 25 sanza ya yambo 2020 ekomi oyo ekokani na moko te mpe oyo bato nyonso ya Chine bakobosana te, mpo bayebisaki bango babima libanda te na fete mobimba mpe na eleko ya bamposo mingi nsima mpo na kobima ya maladi moko ya sika ya makasi.
translated: [' Fete ya printemps na mokolo ya 25 sanza ya yambo 2020 ekomi ekaniseli oyo esalema naino te mpe oyo bato nyonso ya Chine bakobosana te oyo basengaki bango batikala na kati ya ndako mpona fete nyonso mpe na boumeli ya baposo mingi nsima ya kobima ya maladi moko ya sika ya virisi. ']

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Virisi yango ekokani mingi na coronavirisi (CoV) oyo ezalaki maladi ya makasi ya mpema (SARS) na 2003; ebongo babengaki yango SARS-CoV-2 na organisation mondiale de la sante (OMS) na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale 2020, mpe maladi oyo yango ebimisi babengi yango CoV Maladi-19 (COVID-19).
translated: [' Virisi yango ekokani mingi na coronavirisi (CoV) oyo ebimisaki maladi makasi ya mpema (SARS) na 2003; Yango wana, ebengamaki SARS-CoV-2 na Organisation Mondial ya Sante (OMS) na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale 2020, mpe maladi oyo ekanganaki ebengamaki CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19). ']

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Maladi yango mabe ebandaki na mboka Wuhan, na Chine, mpe epanzanaki noki na Chine mobimba mpe na pene ya mikili 50 na mokili mobimba.
translated: [' Maladi mabe ebandaki na Wuhan, na Chine, mpe epanzanaki noki na mboka mobimba mpe pene ya bato mosusu 50 na mokili mobimba. ']

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 2 sanza ya misato 2020, virisi wana esalaki ete bato koleka 80 000 babela COVID-19, ebongo bato koleka 40 000 babikaki mpe babimiaki na lopitalo kasi bato koleka 3 000 bakufaki.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 2 sanza ya misato 2020, virisi esali ete bato koleka 80,000 baza na COVID-19, mpe bato ya maladi koleka 40,000 babimaki lopitalo mpe bato ya maladi koleka 3,000 bakufaki. ']

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: OMS akebisi ete COVID-19 eza “monguna ya nimero 1 ya bato” mpe ekoki kozala makasi koleka terorizme.
translated: [' OMS ekebisi ete COVID-19 eza "monguna ya bato nimero 1" mpe ekoki kozala makasi koleka terorizme. ']

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Na kotalela PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), na nse ya sanza mibale, bato basi babimisaki masolo koleka 200 oyo ezolobela COVID-19 ata mpe virologie, epidemiologie, etiologie, ndenge ya koyeba yango, mpe ndenge ya kosalisa yango, banda basalaki rapore ya liboso na mokolo ya 7 sanza ya yambo 2020 oyo ezolimbola ndenge virisi ezopanzana na bato mingi.
translated: [' Na kotalela PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), na nse ya sanza mibale, koleka mikanda 200 esi ebimaki mpo na COVID-19 ata mpe virologie na yango, epidemiologie, etiologie, ndenge ya koyeba yango, mpe ndenge ya kosalisa yango banda rapore ya liboso ya mokolo ya 7 sanza ya yambo 2020 oyo emonaki ete virisi yango etangolami na bato mingi ya maladi. ']

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Lisolo oyo ezomeka kolobela na mokuse bolukiluki oyo ezosalema na likambo oyo ya sika oyo ezopanzana noki.
translated: [' Botaleli oyo ezali komeka kolobela na mokuse bokoli ya bolukiluki na esika ya sika mpe oyo ezali kokola noki. ']

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Soki likoki ezali, tokomeka kokokanisa COVID-19 na SARS mpe maladi mosusu oyo eutaki na CoV, maladi ya mpema ya moyen-orient (MERS, oyo ebimaki na 2012).
translated: [' Ntango nyonso oyo ekoki, tokomeka kokokanisa COVID-19 na SARS mpe maladi mosusu oyo euti na CoV, maladi ya mpema ya moyen orient (MERS, kobima ya maladi na 2012). ']

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Tokolobela mpe makambo oyo tosi toyekoli na oyo etali kobundisa mpe pronostique ya maladi wana mpe mituna mosusu ya ntina mingi.
translated: [' Tokolobela mpe makambo toyekoli kino sikoyo na oyo etali kobundisa mpe pronostique ya maladi wana mpe mituna mosusu oyo etikali kasi ya lombangu. ']

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: Bato balobaka ete CoVs eza mpenza te maladi oyo ebomaka bato, mingimingi esalaka ete bato 15% bayoka malili 4.
translated: [' Banda kala, CoVs etalelami lokola mikrobe oyo ebomaka te na bato, mingimingi esalaka ete pene ya 15% ya bato babela malili 4. ']

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Kasi, na siekle oyo, tosi tokutani na bavirisi CoVs oyo ebelisaka bato mbala mibale, na ndakisa, SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV, oyo ebimisaki maladi oyo eutaki na Chine na 2003 mpe na Arabie Saudite na 2012, mpe epanzanaki noki na mikili mosusu mpe ezalaki kozwa bato mingi mpe koboma bato ebele mpenza.
translated: [' Kasi, na siekle oyo, tokutani na bato CoVs oyo babelisaka mingi mbala mibale, elingi koloba, SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV, oyo ebimisaki maladi na ebandeli na Chine na 2003 mpe na Arabie Saudite na 2012, mpe eumelaki te epanzanaki na mikili mingi mosusu na morbidité ya nsɔmɔ mpe ezoboma bato. ']

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Yango wana, COVID-19 ya sikoyo eza CoV ya misato oyo ebima na lisolo ya bomoi ya bato.
translated: [' Yango wana, COVID-19 ya sikoyo eza kobima ya misato ya CoV na lisolo ya bomoi ya bato. ']

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Ndenge bamonisi yango na motango. ​Motango 1,1, liboke ya maladi ya mpema oyo esika euta eyebani te elobelamaki na mbala ya liboso na Wuhan na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya mibale 2019 na lisanga ya Chine oyo etalaka makambo ya kolongono ya nzoto.
translated: [' ya pas mieux dans le fig. Fig.1,1, bituluku ya pneumonia oyo ezalaki na esika eyebani te eutaki mbala ya liboso na Wuhan na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 na Commission Nationale ya Santé ya Chine. ']

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Mikolo nsambo na nsima babimisaki ndenge CoV ebandaka.
translated: [' Mikolo nsambo na nsima babimisaki lolenge ya CoV. ']

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya yambo 2020 moto ya liboso akufaki na Wuhan.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya yambo 2020 moto ya liboso ya kobela na Wuhan azwaki maladi. ']

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Na ntango wana, maladi yango ezalaki kopanzana noki na bingumba, na bituka mpe na mikili ya pene.
translated: [' Na ntango wana, maladi yango epalanganaki nokinoki na bingumba ya pembeni, na bitúká mpe na mikili ya pembenipembeni. ']

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 20, balobaki ete minganga bazwi maladi yango, yango emonisaki ete moto akoki kopesa yango na moto mosusu.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya yambo, maladi ya minganga ezalaki na maladi, yango emonisi ete moto apesi moto mosusu maladi wana ekoki kosalema. ']

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya yambo, bakangaki engumba Wuhan mpe transpore ya bato nyonso ezalaki kosala lisusu te.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya yambo, bakangaki engumba Wuhan mpe babisi na yango nyonso ekatanaki. ']

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya yambo, babandaki kosala bolukiluki ya maladi wana, na kati ya bato 41 oyo bazalaki kobela yango, bato 21 mpamba bakomaki na zando ya mbisi ya mbu ya Wuhan esika oyo maladi yango ebandaki na nyama moko oyo eyebani te.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya yambo etid ya liboso ya cliniki na maladi elobaki ete, na kati ya bato ya maladi 41 oyo bazalaki na yango, kaka bato 21 bakutanaki mbala moko na zando ya mbisi ya mbu ya Wuhan oyo etalelamaki lokola esika ya ebandeli ya maladi euti na nyama moko oyo eyebani te. ']

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 30 sanza ya yambo, OMS elobaki ete maladi wana eza likama mpo na mokili mobimba.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 30 sanza ya yambo, OMS elobaki ete kopalangana ya maladi eza likama ya kolongono ya nzoto na mokili mobimba. ']

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Na ntango tozosala rapore oyo, maladi yango esi epanzani na Chine mobimba mpe na mikili misusu pene ya 50 na mokili mobimba (Motango. ​(Motango.2).2).
translated: [' Na ntango ya rapore oyo, maladi esi epanzani na Chine mobimba mpe pene ya mikili 50 mosusu na mokili mobimba (Mot. (Fig.2).2). ']

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Ndenge makambo ezondongwana noki, bonene na yango ya nsuka mpe makasi na yango eyebani nanu te.
translated: [' Lokola makambo ezali kobongwana nokinoki, lolenge ya nsuka mpe makasi ya maladi yango ezali naino koyebana te. ']

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale 2020, bolukiluki na bato ya maladi 8 866 tanga mpe bato 4 021 oyo bazalaki mpenza na COVID-19 emonisaki makambo ya sika na ntina na maladi mabe ndenge eza na nse (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya mibale 2020, etid ya centre mingi na bato 8,866 oyo bazalaki kobela lekola bato 4,021 oyo bazalaki kobela COVID-19 emonisaki elilingi ya sika ya maladi mabe ndenge elandi (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA). ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ezozwa bato ya mbula nyonso, kasi mingimingi bato ya mbula 30-65.
translated: [' SARS-CoV-2 ezwaki bato ya bambula nyonso, kasi mingimingi na mibu 30-65. ']

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Pene ya katikati (47,7%) ya bato oyo babelaki baza na mbula koleka 50, moke mpenza baza na mbula na nse ya 20, mpe bato 14 mpamba ya maladi bazalaki na mbula na nse ya 10.
translated: [' Pene ya katikati (47,7%) ya bato oyo bazwaki maladi bazalaki na mibu koleka 50, moke mpenza bazalaki na mbula na nse ya 20, mpe kaka bato 14 oyo bazwaki maladi bazalaki na nse ya mbula 10. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ezwaki mingi mibali (0,31/100 000) koleka basi(0,27/100 000).
translated: [' SARS-CoV-2 ezwaki mibali mingi (0,31/100 000) koleka basi (0,27/100 000). ']

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 epanzanaki na bituluku mingimingi na Hubei mpe pene na yango.
translated: [' COVID-19 ekomaki monene na bituluku mingimingi na Hubei mpe pene na yango. ']

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 ezwaki na mwayene mikolo 5 (2-9) banda ebandeli kino mokolo bamonaki yango.
translated: [' COVID-19 ezwaki na mwayene mikolo 5 (2-9) banda ebandeli tii ntango bamonaki yango. ']

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Mwayene ya mikolo oyo maladi esalaka liboso emonana eza mikolo 4,8 (3,0-7,2).
translated: [' Mwayene ya eleko ya incubation ezalaki mikolo 4,8 (3,0-7,2). ']

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Mwayene ya mikolo banda ebandeli na yango kino liwa eza mikolo 9,5 (4,8-13).
translated: [' Mwayene ya mikolo banda ebandeli na yango kino liwa ezalaki mikolo 9,5 (4,8-13). ']

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Motango ya kobotisa yango (R0) eza 3,77 (95% CI: 3,51-4,05), mpe kobongwana ya R0 ezalaki 2,23-4,82.
translated: [' Motango ya ntina ya kobota (R0) ezalaki 3,77 (95% CI: 3,51-4,05), mpe R0 oyo babongisaki ezalaki 2,23-4,82. ']

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Motango ya bato oyo bazwi maladi emataki mingi liboso ya mokolo ya 23 ya sanza ya yambo 2020; yango ekokani na ntango oyo bato basalelaki transpore mingi na fete ya printemps na Chine.
translated: [' Motango ya bato oyo baza na maladi emataki mingi liboso ya mokolo ya 23 sanza ya liboso 2020, ekokani na ngonga ya transport ya minene liboso ya Feti ya printemps na Chine. ']

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Bato ya maladi oyo kokufa ezalaki 1,44% (95% CI: 1,10-1,86%), mpe kobongwana ya motango ya bato bakufaki eza 3,06% (95% CI: 2,02-4,59%).
translated: [' Liwa ya bato ya maladi oyo bazalaki na maladi ezalaki 1,44% (95% CI: 1,10-1,86%), mpe mbongwana ya liwa ya bato nyonso ya maladi ezalaki 3,06% (95% CI: 2,02-4,59%). ']

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: Makambo misato ya minene ya likama ya COVID-19 ezalaki sexe (mobali), mbula (≥60), mpe mpema makasi.
translated: [' Makambo misato ya minene ya likama mpo na COVID-19 ezalaki sexe (mobali), mbula (≥60), mpe maladi makasi ya mimpulupulu. ']

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoVs eza na kati ya libota monene ya bvirisi mpe na kati ya bavirisi oyo eza na mwa boyokani na RNA.
translated: [' CoVs ezali libota moko ya moke ya bavirisi ya minene mpe ya amvelopi oyo ezalaka na nsinga moko ya sense RNA. ']

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: Tokoki kokabola yango na biteni minei, na ndakisa., alpha, beta, gamma, mpe delta, ebongo alpha- na beta-CoVs eyebani ete ezwaka bato.
translated: [' Tokoki kokabola yango na ba gene minei, na ndakisa, alpha, beta, gamma, mpe delta, oyo eyebani ete alpha- mpe beta-CoVs eyebani ete ezwaka bato. ']

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: Nsonge ya (S) glycoproteine ekangamaka na ba recepteur na yango ya angiotensine mpe ebongalaka enzyme 2 (ACE2) mpe dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) mpo na SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV, mpe na nsima membrane esanganaka.
translated: [' Spike ya anvelope (S) glycoproteine ekangamaka na ba recepteur na yango ya celluleurs, enzyme 2 (ACE2) mpe dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) mpo na SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV, mpe na nsima membrane esanganaka. ']

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Virisi RNA ebimaka na cytoplasme; nsima ya kopanzana ya virisi wana, virisi RNA eyaka na kati ya anvelope ya glycoproteine mpe baproteine nucleocapside esalaka vesicule oyo eza na virion, oyo esanganaka na plazma mpo na kobimisa virisi.
translated: [' Genome RNA ya virisi ebimaka na cytoplasme; Nsima ya korepliqué ya genome ya virisi, genomiki RNA elongo na anvelopi glycoproteine mpe baproteine nucleocapsid esalaka ba vesicule oyo eza na virion, oyo na nsima esanganaka na membrane ya plasma mpo na kobimisa virisi. ']

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Genome ya liboso ya SARS-CoV-2 emonanaki na mokolo ya 10 sanza ya yambo 2020.
translated: [' Sequence ya liboso ya genomiki ya SARS-CoV-2 emonanaki na mokolo ya 10 sanza ya yambo 2020. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: Bamonaki ete SARS-CoV-2 ezalaki lolenge ya sika ya beta-CoV oyo ezalaki na na identité 99,98% ya makila na kati ya bandakisa 10 oyo bazwaki na esika oyo yango ebimaki na mbala ya liboso, na zando Huanan ya koteka banyama ya mbu na Wuhan.
translated: [' Emonanaki ete SARS-CoV-2 ezalaki lolenge ya sika ya beta-CoV oyo ezalaki na bomoto ya gene koleka 99,98% na kati ya ba echantillon 10 oyo elandanaki oyo bazwaki na esika ya liboso oyo maladi ebimaki, zando ya Huanan Seafood na Wuhan. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ekokani mpenza na SARS-CoV kasi na MERS-CoV te.
translated: [' SARS-CoV-2 ekokani mingi na ba gene na SARS-CoV kasi na MERS-CoV te. ']

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Na nzela ya kopanzana ya electron ya mikroskope, biteni ya SARS-CoV-2 emonanaka na nzoto ya bato na nzela ya kopema.
translated: [' Na nzela ya microscopie ya electron transmission, bamonaki biloko ya SARS-CoV-2 na biteni ya ultrathin ya epithelium ya mopepe ya bato. ']

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: Bamonaki ete ACE2 ya bato ezalaki eloko ezwaka SARS-CoV-2 mpe SARS-CoV.
translated: [' Bamonaki ete ACE2 ya bato ezalaki eloko ezwaka SARS-CoV-2 mpe SARS-CoV. ']

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kasi, proteine S ya SARS-CoV-2 ekangami makasi te na ACE2 ya bato koleka ya SARS-CoV, oyo eyokani na likambo oyo ete SARS-CoV-2 ezopesa bato maladi ya makasi te lokola SARS-CoV.
translated: [' Kasi, proteine S ya SARS-CoV-2 ekangami na ACE2 ya bato makasi te koleka ya SARS-CoV, oyo ezalaka esika moko na likambo oyo ete SARS-CoV-2 esalaka ete bato babela maladi makasi te lokola SARS-CoV. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ekoki mpe kosala proteine ya moke ya sika oyo euti na orf3b mpe ebimisaka proteine euti na orf8.
translated: [' SARS-CoV-2 ekoki mpe kosala proteine ya mikuse ya sika oyo ekomami na code ya orf3b mpe proteine moko ya sekele oyo ekomami na code ya orf8. ']

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: Lolenge orf3b ya SARS-CoV-2 ekoki kozala na mokumba makasi na kobima ya virisi wana mpe komonisa bilembo ya IFNβ; kasi, orf8 ezalaka te na mosala to motif oyo eyebana.
translated: [' Orf3b ya SARS-CoV-2 ekoki kosala mosala na virisi oyo epesaka maladi mpe kokanga nzela na komonisa IFNβ; Kasi, Orf8 eza te na domaine to motif moko oyo eyebani oyo eyebani. ']

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 18 sanza ya mibale 2020, Zhou, mpe baninga, elobelaki nzoto ya cryo-EM ya ACE2 ya bato ya molai mpenza na 2,9 Å ya mindondo ezalaki na eloko ememaka aside amino B0AT1.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 18 sanza ya mibale 2020, Zhou, mpe baninga na ye, elobelaki ebongiseli ya cryo-EM ya ACE2 ya bato nyonso na 2.9 Å resolution na mindondo na eloko ememaka aside amino B0AT1. ']

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Bamonaki ete mindondo wana, oyo ezalaki kofungwama mpe kokangama, esangisamaki esika moko mpe ACE2-B0AT1 ya mindondo ekoki kosangisa baproteine S mibale, oyo ezopesa bilembeteli ya koyeba CoV mpe maladi wana.
translated: [' Bamonaki ete mindondo wana, oyo ezalaki na ba conformation ya kofungwama mpe ya kokanga, basangisaki yango lokola dimer mpe ACE2-B0AT1 ya mindondo ekoki kokanga baproteine S mibale, oyo epesi bilembeteli ya koyeba CoV mpe maladi wana. ']

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 ekoki kokoma eloko ya kosalela bankisi mpo na kosilisa maladi ya SARS-CoV-2.
translated: [' B0AT1 ekoki kokoma nkisi ya kosalisa ekzame ya kisi mpo na koboma maladi ya SARS-CoV-2. ']

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Esika eutaka mpe esika ya mibale oyo efandaka
translated: [' Esika ya ebandeli mpe esika ya katikati oyo efandaka ']

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: Eyebani ete SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV eutaki na bangembo mpe epesamaki na bato na nzela ya banyau civet mpe bakamela.
translated: [' Eyebani ete SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV eutaki na bangembo mpe epesamaki na bato na nzela ya nyau civet mpe bakamela. ']

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Soki tosali bokokanisi na kati ya SARS-CoV-2 na ba CoVs mosusu, bangembo nde bato bazalaki na SARS-CoV-2 mpo virisi oyo ya sika ekokani na 96% na bavirisi CoVs oyo ekokokani na ba SARS mibale oyo eutaki na bangembo oyo babengaka bat-SL-CoVZX45 mpe bat-SL-CoVZX21.
translated: [' Na nzela ya bokokanisi ya phylogenetique ya SARS-CoV-2 na ba CoVs mosusu, bangembo batalelamaki lokola esika mobotami ya SARS-CoV-2 mpo virisi ya sika ekokani na 96% ndenge moko na CoVs mibale oyo ekokani na SARS oyo euti na bangembo oyo babengi bat-SL-CoVZX45 mpe bat-SL-CoVZX21. ']

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Kasi, eloko oyo esalisaki virisi na kolongwa na banyama mpo eya kokota na bato eyebani nanu te, mpe toyebi nanu te ekotaki na nzela nini.
translated: [' Kasi, esika nini ya mibale oyo efandaka esalisaki virisi na kokatisa mokakatano ya lolenge wana mpo na kozwa bato eyebani naino te, mpe nzela ya kopanza yango eyebani nanu te. ']

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, mpe baninga na ye, balobaki ete banyoka nde ememaki virisi wana uta na bangembo mpe ekotisaki yango na bato; mpe esanganaki na kati ya proteine S.
translated: [' Ji, mpe baninga na ye, bapesaki likanisi ya kosala banyoka lokola eloko ememaka virisi banda na bangembo kino na bato oyo ezalaki kosangisa lisusu homologous na kati ya proteine S. ']

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Na kotalela bolukiluki moko, balukiluki esalemaki na Guangzhou, na Chine, balobaki ete bapangolin - oyo ezali banyama ebengami mamifere oyo basalelaka mbala mingi lokola bankisi ya bokoko na Chine - eza oyo mbala mosusu esika ya mibale oyo SARS-CoV-2 efandaka na kotalela 99% ya makila ya ndenge moko na CoV oyo bamonaki na bapangolin mpe na SARS-CoV-2.
translated: [' Na kotalela bolukiluki moko, bato ya mayele na Guangzhou, na Chine, balobaki ete bapangolin - oyo ezalaka na misisa banda kala, banyama oyo elyaka bafurmi oyo basalelaka mbala mingi na nkisi ya kala ya Chine - nde ekoki kozala esika ya mibale oyo SARS-CoV-2 efandaka na kotalela 99% ya ndenge moko na gene na CoV oyo bamonaki na bapangolin mpe SARS-CoV-2. ']

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Kasi, bokeseni ya 1% etaleli bavirisi mibale eza kaka bokeseni monene; yango wana, tozokoba kozela bosukisi ya solosolo (Mot. ​(Mot.33).
translated: [' Kasi, bokeseni ya 1% oyo epalangani na ba genome nyonso mibale eza kaka bokeseni monene; Na yango, ba résultat ya sikisiki ya bilembeteli ya solosolo ezozela (Moteyi). (Etape 33) ']

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Makambo ya physique mpe ya chimie ya SARS-CoV-2 eyebani nanu ata moke te.
translated: [' Makambo ya physique mpe ya chimie ya SARS-CoV-2 eyebani nanu te. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV ekoki kozala na bomoi na libanda ya esika oyo bazalaka na bomoi na bangonga 48 na esika ya kokauka mpe kino na mikolo 5 na nse ya 20 °C mpe na 40%-50% na esika ya malili.
translated: [' SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV ekoki kozala na bomoi na esika oyo ezali na kati ya bangonga 48 na esika ya kokauka mpe kino na mikolo 5 na nse ya 20 °C mpe na 40%-50% na esika ya malili. ']

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ekoki kozala na bizaleli ya ndenge moko.
translated: [' SARS-CoV-2 ekoki kozala na bizaleli ya ndenge moko. ']

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: Bato bazoloba ete SARS-CoV-2 ekokaka te na ba rayons ultraviolet mpe moto na badegre 56 °C na miniti 30; to, 75% ya ethanole, desinfectant oyo eza na chlore, aside perasetique, chloroforme, mpe bankisi mosusu ya koboma mikrobe, kasi te chlorhexidine, ekoki mpenza koboma virisi wana.
translated: [' Elobami ete SARS-CoV-2 ezalaka mpasi na rayons ultraviolet mpe molunge na 56 °C na miniti 30; ether, 75% ya ethanol, nkisi ya koboma mikrobe oyo eza na chlore, aside ya peracetic, chloroform, mpe biloko mosusu oyo ebomaka mafuta, kasi chlorhexidine te, ekoki mpenza kofungola virisi. ']

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Bato nyonso bazangi mikrobe oyo ebundisaka SARS-CoV-2, yango wana virisi oyo ya sika ekoki kozwa bango.
translated: [' Mbala mingi bato nyonso ya bato bazangi komibatela na SARS-CoV-2 mpe yango wana virisi ya sika ekoki kozwa yango. ']

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Sikoyo, basali nanu te bolukiluki ya mozindo na oyo etali ndenge ya kobundisa SARS-CoV-2.
translated: [' Sikoyo, ata bolukiluki moko te ya mozindo eyebisami na oyo etali kobundisa immunologie na SARS-CoV-2. ']

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Yango wana, tokoki kolobela kaka bolukiluki ya kala na oyo etali ba CoVs mosusu, mingimingi SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV (Mot. ​(Mot.4).4).
translated: [' Yango wana, tokoki kolobela kaka bolukiluki ya kala oyo esalemaki na CoVs mosusu, mingimingi SARS-CoV mpe MERS-CoV (Fig. (Fig.4).4). ']

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Mbala mingi, soki virisi ekoteli eloko moko, mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi mabe eyebaka yango na nzela ya mayele ya koyeba biloko mosusu (PRRs) tanga mpe lolenge na yango C ya biloko oyo ememaka yango, biloko ememaka yango oyo eza neti Toll(TLR), mpe oyo eza neti NOD (NLR), mpe oyo eza neti RIG-I (RLR).
translated: [' Mbala mingi, nsima ya virisi ekota na esika oyo efandaka, eyebani liboso na systeme immunitaire ya esika efandaka na nzela ya ba recepteur ya koyeba pattern (PRRs) ata mpe ba recepteur ya lolenge C oyo eza lokola lectin, Toll-like receptor (TLR), oyo eza neti NOD (NLR), mpe oyo eza neti RIG-I (rlr). ']

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Na lisalisi ya banzela ekeseni, virisi ebimisaka mpasi na nzoto, ekolisaka baselile dentritique, mpe esangisaka na mokuse ba interferon oyo eza neti I (IFNs) oyo ekangaka virisi nzela mpo epanzana te mpe esalaka ete biloko oyo ekangaka virisi nzela ebima noki.
translated: [' Na nzela ya banzela ekeseni, virisi ebimisaka komonisa makambo oyo evimbisaka nzoto, kokɔmela ya baselile ya dendritic, mpe kosangisa ba interferon ya lolenge I (IFNs) oyo epekisaka virisi epanzana mpe esalaka ete macrophage, phagocytosis ya ba antigènes ya virisi ekende liboso. ']

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Kasi, proteine N ya SARS-CoV ekoki kosalisa virisi na kokima bopusi ya mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi.
translated: [' Kasi, proteine N ya SARS-CoV ekoki kosalisa virisi na kokima mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi. ']

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Kala mingi te, mikrobe oyo ebundisaka virisi esanganaka mpo na kobundisa yango.
translated: [' Mosika te, mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi oyo emesanaka esanganaka na kobundisa virisi. ']

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: Balymfosite T tanga mpe CD4+ mpe CD8+ baselile T esalaka mosala makasi na kobundisa maladi.
translated: [' Ba lymphocytes T ata mpe CD4+ mpe CD8+ baselile T esalaka mosala monene mpo na kobatela yango. ']

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4+ baselile T elendisaka baselile B mpo na kobimisa mikrobe oyo ebundisaka virisi, mpe CD8+ baselile T ebomaka mbala moko baselile oyo virisi ekoteli yango.
translated: [' CD4+ baselile T elendisaka baselile B mpo na kobimisa ba anticorps ya virisi-specifiki, mpe CD8+ baselile T ebomaka mbala moko baselile oyo ezali na virisi. ']

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Baselile ya kosalisa T ebimisaka ba cytokine oyo ebimisaka mokusa mpo na kosalisa baselile oyo ebundaka.
translated: [' Baselile ya basungi T ebimisaka ba cytokine ya proinflammatory mpo na kosalisa baselile oyo ezali kokɔtela yango. ']

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Kasi, CoV ekoki kopekisa selile T esala mosala na yango na modele ya kokufa baselile T.
translated: [' Kasi, CoV ekoki kopekisa baselile T esalaka mosala soki ebimisaka apoptosis ya baselile T. ']

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi oyo esanganaka ndakisa C3a mpe C5a mpe ba anti corps eza mpe ntina mpo na kobundisa virisi oyo.
translated: [' Immunité ya humor ata mpe ba complements lokola C3a na C5a mpe ba anticorps eza mpe ntina mingi mpo na kobundisa maladi ya virisi. ']

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Na ndakisa, ba anti corps oyo balongolaki na bato oyo babikaki ebomaki MERS-CoV.
translated: [' Na ndakisa, ba anticorps oyo balongolaki na moto ya maladi oyo babiki babɔtɔlaki MERS-CoV. ']

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Kasi, reaction ya koleka ndelo ya mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi ekoki kobimisa ba radicale mingi koleka na nzoto mpe yango ekoki kobebisa bapoumon mpe binama mosusu, mpe likambo ya mabe koleka, ekoki kosala ete binama mingi esala lisusu te mpe nkutu ekoki komema na liwa.
translated: [' Na ndambo mosusu, reaction ya koleka ndelo ya mikrobe oyo ebundisaka maladi ebimisaka ba radicale mingi ya bonsomi na mboka oyo ekoki kobebisa makasi bapoumon mpe binama mosusu, mpe, na ndenge ya mabe koleka, kobeba ya binama mingi mpe ata liwa. ']

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Maladi ya SARS-CoV-2 , oyo ekabwanaka na ebandeli, ezozwa mingi mibange oyo baza na maladi mosusu mpe basi ya zemi.
translated: [' Maladi ya SARS-CoV-2, oyo emonanaka na bisika ebele, ezozwa mingi mibange oyo baza na comorbidité mpe basi ya zemi. ']

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Mbala mingi bato oyo bakutanaka na bavirisi mingi to oyo mikrobe na bango oyo ebundisaka maladi elemba, baza na likama mingi ya kozwa maladi oyo koleka bato mosusu.
translated: [' Emonanaka mingi ete mpo na bato oyo bakutanaka na bavirisi mingi to oyo misala na bango ya kobundisa maladi ebebi, bazalaka na libaku mingi ya kozwa maladi koleka bato mosusu. ']

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Eleko oyo maladi ya SARS-CoV-2 esalaka mpo emonana eza mikolo 1-14, mingimingi mikolo 3-7 na kotalela bolukiluki esalemaki na bato 425 ya liboso oyo bazwaki yango na Wuhan.
translated: [' Ekanisami ete eleko oyo maladi ya SARS-CoV-2 esalaka mpo emonana eza mikolo 1-14, mingimingi mikolo 3-7 na kotalela bolukiluki esalemaki na bato 425 ya liboso oyo babelaki na Wuhan. ']

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Kasi, bolukiluki oyo esalemaki na bato 1 099 emonisi ete eleko oyo maladi esalaka mpo emonana ezalaki mikolo 3 na mwayene mpe ebandaki na mikolo 0 kino na 24.
translated: [' Kasi, bolukiluki na bato 1 099 oyo bazobela emonisi ete eleko oyo maladi esalaka mpo emonana ezalaki mikolo 3 na mwayene mpe ebandaki na mikolo 0 kino na 24. ']

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Bolukiluki moko ya sika mpenza, ndenge balobeli yango na likolo, elakisi ete eleko oyo maladi esalaka mpo emonana ezalaki mikolo 4,8 (3,0-7,2) na kotalela bato 8 866 oyo balandelaki.
translated: [' Bolukiluki moko ya sika, ndenge balimboli yango likolo, emonisi ete eleko oyo maladi esalaka mpo emonana ezalaki mikolo 4,8 (3,0-7,2) na kotalela motango ya bato 8 866 oyo bazwaki yango. ']

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Eza na ntina mingi mpo na minganga na kobongola eleko ya kotya moto na quarantaine na kotalela eleko ya solo oyo maladi esalaka mpo emonana, ebongo ekokanga nzela mpo bato oyo baza na bilembo ya maladi bapesa bato mosusu virisi te.
translated: [' Eza ntina mingi ete bakonzi ya kolongono babongola ngonga ya malamu ya kotya bato na quarantaine na kotalela eleko ya malamu mpenza ya incubation, yango wana ekopekisa bato oyo baza na maladi kasi oyo baza na basymptomi te na kopesa bato mosusu virisi. ']

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Ndenge esalemaka mbala mingi, mpo na bato oyo bakutanaki na bato ya maladi oyo to baza na maladi yango, virisi wana esengaka ete batya yango na quarantaine mikolo 14.
translated: [' Lokola esalemaka mingi, mbala mingi bato oyo bakutanaka na yango, to oyo baza na yango, mbala mingi virisi esengeli batya yango konfinema mpona mikolo 14. ']

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Esengeli nde mikolo ya quarantaine ekoma mikolo 24?
translated: [' Esengeli kobakisa mikolo ya quarantaine na mikolo 24? ']

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Fievre eza mbala mingi elembo ya ntina mingi mpe ya liboso ya COVID-19, oyo ekoki koya yango moko to na bilembo mosusu na ndakisa kosukosu ya makasi, kokatana ya mpema, mpasi na misisa, vertige, moto mpasi, mongongo mpasi, kokangama ya zolo, mpasi na ntolo, pulupulu, mposa ya kosanza, mpe kosanza.
translated: [' Fievre eza mbala mingi elembo ya monene mpe ya ebandeli ya COVID-19, oyo ekoki kozala elongo na elembo te to bilembo mosusu te na ndakisa kosukosu ya makasi, mpema mokuse, mpasi na misisa, kizunguzungu, moto mpasi, mongongo mpasi, rhinorrhee, mpasi na tolo, pulupulu, mposa ya kosanza, mpe kosanza. ']

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Bato mosusu ya maladi bapemaka na mpasi mpe/to bazangaka mpema mwa moke mposo moko na nsima ya ebandeli ya maladi.
translated: [' Bato mosusu ya maladi bakutanaki na dyspnea mpe/to hypoxemia mposo moko nsima ya ebandeli ya maladi. ']

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Na bandakisa ya makasi, bato ya maladi bakomaki noki na mpasi ya kopema, motema ebetaka malamu te, nzoto ebimisaka aside mingi, mpe makila ezokoka kokangama te.
translated: [' Na bandakisa ya makasi, bato ya maladi bakolaki noki mpe bakómaki kobela syndrome ya makasi ya kopema, choque septic, metabolique acidose, mpe coagulopathy. ']

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Bato oyo baza na fievre mpe/to mpasi ya kopema mpe fievre ya makasi, ata soki bakanisi ete baza na mpasi na poumon, basengeli kosala bango ekzame mpo na koyeba soki baza na maladi wana.
translated: [' Bato ya maladi oyo baza na fievre mpe/to bilembo ya mpema mpe fievre ya makasi, ata kozanga maladi ya lipili na bililingi, basengeli kosala bango ekzame ya virisi mpo na koyeba yango noki. ']

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Bolukiluki na mwa ndambo ya bato oyo esalemaki na nsuka ya sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 emonisaki ete bilembo ya maladi ezalaki 98% mpo na fievre, 76% mpo na kosukosu, 55% mpo na vertige, mpe 3% mpo na pulupulu; 8% ya bato bazalaki na mposa ya lisalisi ya mopepe.
translated: [' Bolukiluki ya bato na nsuka ya sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 emonisaki ete pourcentage ya bilembo ezalaki 98% mpo na fievre, 76% mpo na kosukosu ya kokauka, 55% mpo na dyspnea, mpe 3% mpo na pulupulu; 8% ya bato ya maladi bazalaki na mposa ya lisalisi ya ventilateur. ']

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Bazwaki makambo ya ndenge moko na bolukiluki mibale ya sika oyo basalaki na biloko oyo ebimisaka maladi mpe oyo epanzaka yango na bato oyo baza na yango te.
translated: [' Bamonaki makambo ya ndenge moko na bolukiluki mibale ya sika ya etuluku moko ya libota mpe liboke moko oyo euti na kopanzana ya moto oyo azalaki na bilembo te. ']

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Kasi, bolukilluki oyo esalemaki na 2012 emonisaki ete bato oyo bazobela MERS-CoV mpe mingi bazalaki na fievre (98%), kosukosu ya makasi (47%), mpe mpema mokuse (55%) na kati ya bilembo ya minene.
translated: [' Likambo ya kosolola, bolukiluki ya motango ya bato na 2012 emonisaki ete bato oyo babelaki MERS-CoV bazalaki mpe na fievre (98%), kosukosu ya makasi (47%), mpe dyspnea (55%) ezalaki bilembo na bango ya minene. ']

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Kasi, 80% na bango bazalaki na mposa ya lisalisi ya mopepe, mingi koleka bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 mpe ezoboma bato ndeko moko na MERS kasi lokola COVID-19.
translated: [' Kasi, 80% na bango bazalaki na mposa ya lisalisi ya ventilateur, mingi koleka bato oyo bazobela COVID-19 mpe eyokani na maladi ya koboma MERS mingi koleka COVID-19. ']

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Pulupulu (26%) mpe mongongo mpasi (21%) emonanaki mpe na bato oyo bazalaki kobela MERS.
translated: [' Pulupulu (26%) mpe mongongo mpasi (21%) emonanaki mpe na bato oyo bazalaki kobela MERS. ']

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Na bato oyo bazalaki kobela SARS, emonanaki ete fievre (99%-100%), kosukosu ya makasi (29%-75%), vertige (40%-42%), pulupulu (20-25%), mpe mongongo mpasi (13-25%) ezalaki bilembo ya minene mpe bato pene ya 14%-20% bazalaki na mposa ya lisalisi ya mopepe.
translated: [' Na bato oyo babelaki SARS, emonani ete fievre (99%-100%), kosukosu ya makasi (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), pulupulu (20-25%), mpe mongongo mpasi (13-25%) ezalaki bilembo ya minene mpe lisungi ya ventilateur esengelaki mpona bato pene ya 14%-20% ya bato ya maladi. ']

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya mibale, bato bakufaki na COVID-19 bazalaki 2% ntango motango ya bato ekomaki 66 576 na mokili mobimba.
translated: [' Na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya mibale, bato oyo bakufaki na COVID-19 bazalaki 2% ntango bato oyo bazalaki na yango bakómaki 66 576 na mokili mobimba. ']

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Soki tosali bokokanisi, bato oyo bakufaki na SARS na sanza ya zomi na moko 2002 bazalaki 10% na kati ya bato 8 096 oyo babelaki yango.
translated: [' Likambo ya kokamwa, bato oyo bakufaki na SARS na sanza ya zomi na moko 2002 bazalaki 10% na kati ya bato 8 096 oyo bazalaki na yango. ']

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: Mpo na MERS, na kotalela bolukiluki na motango ya bato oyo esalemaki na sanza ya motoba 2012, bato oyo bakufaki bazalaki 37% na kati ya bato 2 494 oyo babelaki yango.
